alert.note: Alert for Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; San Rafael Swell; Southern Mountains; Western Canyonlands (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:34PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Wayne...southwestern Emery and southeastern Sevier Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 333 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles northeast of Torrey, or 20 miles north of Capitol Reef National Park, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Capitol Reef National Park including the Cathedral Valley area and Fruita. This includes Utah Route 24 between mile markers 78 and 86. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; San Rafael Swell; Southern Mountains; Western Canyonlands
